Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2009 12:49PM - edited Feb 17, 2009 01:49PM by choward183 diamondgurl.. I am from Queens, NY and I have an excellent breast surgeon, he is well known in the field of diseases of the breast.  He has been in practice for over 34 years, he has late office hours, and from what I understand he is in the office some nights as late as midnight!  If you are interested PM and I will give you his name and telephone number, incidentally he is located in Great Neck NY.
Posts.Title: Bilateral Mastectomy DiamondGurl Superwoman808

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2009 05:13AM choward183 wrote: You are doing the right thing by being there for her, and also educating your self on breast cancer. I suggest that you pray and you be a shoulder for her.  I find with my DX, that my love ones just didn't know what to say to me.  They felt so bad, that I felt sorry for them!  Thank God that my breast cancer was found early, I elected to have bilateral mastectomy, because I did not want to go through this again.
Posts.Title: How do I help my sister??? wanting_to_help wanting_to_help
